description: We offer a range of building regulations drawings and accompanying notes, which can be used either as part of a Building Regulations application for Full Plans Approval, or alternatively as construction details to be issued to trades or suppliers for quotation purposes or to act as a benchmark for workmanship and product performance. The following explanation of a Full Plans application is from the Planning Portal: "You can apply for Building Regulations approval from your local authority Building Control Service by submitting a full plans application. An application deposited under this procedure needs to contain plans and other information showing all construction details, preferably well in advance of when work is to start on site. Your local authority will check your plans and consult any appropriate authorities (e.g. fire and sewerage). They must complete the procedure by issuing you with a decision within five weeks or, if you agree, a maximum of two months from the date of deposit."
